name: Habibi Grill
address: 1131 N 4th St, Columbus, OH 43201, USA

reviews.text:
On my first trip to Ohio, a staff member at the airport rental center suggested this restaurant, and the culinary experience exceeded expectations. The lamb shank entree I ordered was expertly prepared, with the lamb cooked to perfection, possessing a delicate flavor profile, and a tender, moist texture. The accompanying rice was cooked to perfection and seasoned judiciously, with a generous portion provided. The vegetables were also noteworthy. The service was attentive, with my meal arriving quickly, hot, and freshly prepared.

⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️

I've been here a few times and crave it often! The restaurant itself is pretty spacious and has two dining areas. The parking is a bit tricky in their lot but there's street parking available. The restaurant is usually lively and busy, but it's welcoming.

There's a self serve station for plates, utensils, seasonings, and water!
We usually get a couple entrees to share and you really can't go wrong with anything. They also have platter options for groups and their portions are decently sized and filling.
I really enjoy their lamb and beef options, they're flavorful and made well. Their hummus is absolutely delicious, I recommend! I also liked their spicy potato side dish, it was very good. I also recommend their spiced chai, it's warm, flavorful, and sweet.
Overall, you can't go wrong and you'll be back to try it all.

Staff is always kind, always helpful, and they'll take care of you!
I recommend them for groups, casual date, tasty food, and a good experience! Have been back many times and will continue to come back.

Food was served quickly and fresh. Taste hit all the right spots. Environment very family friendly. Staff super friendly. Quick service. Thank you so much for the delightful food! Came here twice and will come again also !

Walked in to a very welcoming staff who was able to assist me with placing my to-go order. Ordered the savory Lamb Shank which came with yellow rice and taziki sauce, crushed lentil soup (lemon, carrots, garlic and their special spice blend)c baklava (4 pieces), and their delicious Freez Mix carbonated pineapple & coconut flavored drink. Loved everything I ordered. Sit was a challenge because there are too many great options on that menu.
The food was AMAZING!

It’s unique do it yourself style has grown on me. It was fun. Great vibes. Comfortable establishment. Friendly staff. The food is excellent the flavors were an experience in itself. Definitely try this place

profile: Habibi Grill is a Restaurant restaurant in columbus with a $$ price range. It has a rating of 4.6/5. It is known for being romantic, authentic, takeout, late night, comfort food, family friendly, quick service and casual. A popular dish is Staff.

name: The O on Lane
address: 352 W Lane Ave, Columbus, OH 43201, USA

reviews.text: Excellent, friendly, service.  The toasted ravioli with homemade sauce is perfect. The pepperoni pizza is an A+ delicious, fresh, and one of the best in town.  The atmosphere is really nice and the vibe is great!!

We came here on game day! We ordered off the game day menu, the pizza and loaded fries were pretty good! Food came out fast and service was prompt! The only thing that might bother some people is the loud music, but some people may enjoy the “party” vibe! Glad we tried it but probably try someplace different next time we visit town!
Very good food, pizza was awsome, staff very friendly and outgoing.

Great pizza, server and atmosphere. Server was super friendly and accommodating to menu tweaks. The food was made quickly and the pizza was delicious. The chef got the pizza crust right. Was glad we stopped here for dinner when on campus.

The pizza isn't east coast style but it tastes great. The highlight is the dough which is just about perfect. It's perfectly cooked and has just the right amount of black on it. If you never eat your crust, you will here.

profile: The O on Lane is a Bar/Pub, Restaurant restaurant in columbus with a $$ price range. It has a rating of 4.6/5. It is known for being quick service, comfort food and authentic. A popular dish is The Pizza.

name: ['plas]
address: 21 E 5th Ave #101, Columbus, OH 43201, USA

reviews.text: We decided to try the chefs whim menu with the wine pairings. Honestly such a great value for the price. The menu states that it’s 5-8 courses. Ours ended up being 6 with a bonus appetizer. See photos. Ours happened to still be on the winter menu. We can wait to go back to try the spring menu, we will most definitely be doing the chefs whim menu again. Drew was our server he was fantastic and knowledgeable on the menu offerings. Jackie was the bartender that assisted with the wine pairing, she was so knowledgeable on every wine that was served and seemed so passionate about the wines, origins and notes. Truly an exceptional experience at [‘plas].

Really glad we went! They do an amazing job with their menu - mixing flavors that you wouldn’t think would go together. With that being said, I did feel like it was missing something. Everything I ate was delicious… but it wasn’t 10/10. I’m not quite sure what it was missing, but that X factor just wasn’t there for me. They do an incredible job however, and the taste, texture and look of the food is very high end.

Something I was disappointed in however, was the restaurant’s ambience. With such quality food I expected the vibe to match. The tables and wicker placemats just didn’t live up to the vision I had when I thought of this quaint little place before stepping foot inside.

The duck entree was amazing! I love duck, and I really enjoyed how it was prepared here.

I decided to order the panna cotta appetizer since I've never had panna cotta in a savory dish - it was weird. It was the kind of weird you get when people try a little too hard to be creative... The creamy custard with the umami broth and apples plus mushrooms was not a good pairing. This shouldn't even be on the menu.

For dessert, we had the apple cheesecake and that was forgettable.

I question whether I'd want to ever come back to this restaurant. The first thing I encountered after parking on the side street was an incoherent, screaming crackhead unintelligibly approaching me. Great staff and service once you get inside the restaurant.

Where do I start, we had the chef's whim and it was amazing! Every course that came out was amazing. Taste, presentation, and timing. We also did the wine pairing with it. Jackie knows her stuff. All the staff was so happy and knowledgeable. I can't express how amazing this dining experience was.

My wife and I came here for our 1st anniversary dinner while we were in town for the week. She is Vegan and there are many options around that cater, however I was looking for something that we could walk to and intimate. 'plas was the perfect location. We did the vegan formaggio board which was a meal in itself. However, I was eying the 'Chef's Whim' as it could be made entirely vegan. 5 courses, all shown in the pictures. We split that and as she says, it was some of the best food she has ever had. We also did a drink pairing with it which was phenomenal. This was a late Tuesday night, so we nearly had the restaurant to ourselves which just made the experience over the top. It truly felt like we had a private dinner experience. Only the meatball was the on menu vegan item that the chef prepared, which was fantastic. However, everything else was superb. I try to take my wife to places that have good vegan options, but we don't have as much in the Cleveland area. Not to this level. So I am glad we went with the Whim because it was just a surprise the whole night, with nothing short of perfection. The entire staff was excellent and we cannot wait to come back! The food courses were 1) spring roll, 2) vegan sashimi, 3) chickn meatball, savory crepes (our favorite), and a fruit desert.

profile: ['plas] is a Restaurant restaurant in columbus with a Unknown price range. It has a rating of 4.8/5. It is known for being romantic, healthy, authentic, takeout and late night. Popular dishes include Ours, Jackie, They, With, This, However and Whim.

name: Modern Southern Table
address: 1086 N 4th St, Columbus, OH 43201, USA

reviews.text: First time here , location was east to find and plenty of parking .  There were so many options in the place , but I can for the soul food .  The food was actually really really good . I had the fried catfish with yams and collard greens . Also had the kool-aid , was about $25 .  Yams were sweet and delicious, greens were also very good . The catfish and cornbread both were cooked to perfection. I would highly recommend this place . My only critique is the cashiers took like 7 minutes to acknowledge my presence. She Was packaging another order ,  but could have at least said “hi, I’ll be with you in one second “ vs awkward silence . I was gonna walk away and try something else when she finally asked what I’d like to have . Other wise good experience

I ordered the Catfish special that comes with two pieces of catfish and two sides for a total of $25.95 w/ tip. The service was quick and the manager was easy going and answered all of my questions as a first timer.

My order included two pieces of catfish with a side of greens and Mac. The catfish was seasoned beautifully but the greens lacked flavor. The Mac and Cheese was really dry and had practically no flavoring.

I would try them again because I hear the Gumbo is really tasty.

I wish I had taken a picture before I dug in. Fantastic food, the batter on the chicken was amazing. Super light and crispy. I went with the white meat and the breast and wing was awesome.  Well worth the extra dollar. Honestly the entire meal was underpriced. The red rice was great and solid Mac and cheese. The staff was super friendly, even told me it would be a long wait and my food was ready in 10 min. Really cool food hall but this is the spot to hit up. Check it out, you won’t be disappointed!

I loveeeeeee modern southern table!!!! This restaurant right here needs to be a franchise hands down!!!!.... The food is always hot and fresh and on point every single time I order. My husband is a huge picky eater and modern southern table is his favorite he orders the chicken dinners   twice a day 7days a week!.... the flavor of the food is literally the Alabama touch for real!!! You will never be disappointed!!!
Sorry about the picture I started eating it before I took a picture.. it's so good 😊
Catfish dinner with 2 sides and cornbread 🤤🤤🥰🥰😋😋😋

Service here was amazing! The cashier walked us through our confusion on what we thought we should order gracefully.

5 piece wings were served hot, fried fresh and were seasoned well however they were super small. Ordered regular and the ones with the dust. I think we should have gotten the 2 piece meal because it would have been a better deal but we were not sure originally on what to order.

They were out of the rice so we tried Greens and Mac n cheese were tasty. Cornbread was also good. Would not mind coming back to try other menu items like the fish and other items when we come back to town l.

profile: Modern Southern Table is a Restaurant restaurant in columbus with a $ price range. It has a rating of 4.4/5. It is known for being quick service and authentic. Popular dishes include Catfish and The Chicken.

name: The Guild House
address: 624 N High St, Columbus, OH 43215, USA

reviews.text:
I recently dined at The Guild House, and overall, it was a pleasant experience. The decor is truly beautiful, creating a warm and inviting atmosphere that sets the stage for an enjoyable meal.

The menu is versatile, offering a variety of options that cater to different tastes and preferences. The food was great—every dish we tried was delicious and thoughtfully prepared, making for a satisfying dining experience.

However, the service left something to be desired. While we noticed other waiters checking on their tables like clockwork, our waitress was barely there. This inconsistency in service was a bit disappointing, but it didn't completely overshadow the positive aspects of our visit.

Overall, The Guild House is still worth a visit, depending on the server one gets. With its beautiful decor, versatile menu, and great food, it has the potential to be a fantastic dining experience.

Came in on a Monday after having lived in Columbus over 2 decades ago and not visiting since. The Downtown scene has changed significantly for the better and this restaurant is definitely a gem on top of an onslaught of pretty decent other options. Had the burrata on top of toast. Wish the schmear of burrata could have been more heavy handed, but the pickled red onions on top really cuts through the richness of the cheese as a welcome addition.  The broth that enrobed the dumplings was phenomenal and the veggies especially the mushrooms were blanched to perfection, but the dumplings themselves were a bit too al dente for me.  The serve was great and checked in on us at appropriate intervals.  His suggestion to try the cocktail of the moment was impeccable especially since we told him how much we adore gin. Won't hesitate to come back next time I'm back in town

We went for a double date while in town for a friend's wedding. The food was great, and our server was fantastic! The lobster angolotti was my favorite of the dishes we ordered...it was cooked perfectly and so flavorful. The chicken dish was a little dry, but the beans with it were amazing. Could have been a standalone dish. This was the best carrot cake we've ever had.

Amazing place! Nice, quiet music, friendly staff, beautiful bar, incredible food! I was here for brunch and had local wagyu and lobster and eggs along with some cocktails and everything was great! Thank you for amazing experience, much success to you!

I came here during the Arnold Sports Festival. I had the special protein breakfast sandwich and the overnight oats. It was one of the best, if not the best, breakfasts I have ever had. Amazing chill environment and very positive energy!

profile: The Guild House is a Restaurant restaurant in columbus with a $$$ price range. It has a rating of 4.5/5. It is known for being quick service, romantic, casual and authentic. Popular dishes include The Guild House and This.

name: Bodega
address: 1044 N High St, Columbus, OH 43201, USA

reviews.text:
I visited Bodega on a Saturday night with friends. The staff were friendly and attentive. They assisted us with finding a table when we booked a reservation incorrectly.The restaurant decor was nice. The food was good as well. The Buffalo Chicken Dip was an 8/10. I would give the Cripsy Chicken Sandwich (Nashville Hot Chicken Style) a 7/10. I liked the sauce but the chicken itself wasn’t very well seasoned, though it was nicely cooked. The fries were an 8/10 with a good balance of crispiness and flavor. The Moscow Mule was also an 8/10. The taste was good. I didn’t feel as much of a buzz as I usually do with a mule, but that could have been due to me drinking my cocktail a little slower than usual. I would order the drink again.

A few critiques are that they were out of white wine and therefore couldn’t make a drink one of my friends was interested in. They also switched the vibe of the restaurant around 10 o’clock. It took on more of a bar/club scene. Staff stationed themselves at the door and began checking people’s I.D.’s prior to entry and a DJ started playing really loud music that made it difficult to hear one another as we talked at our table. This wasn’t necessarily a bad thing. The DJ sounded good. It just wasn’t the setting we were looking for. It would have been nice if the staff would have communicated this switch to us a few minutes prior or when we arrived, so we’d have a heads up.

Overall, I enjoyed my visit and I would return.

The bartender Johnathan provided excellent service and offered a warm and welcoming atmosphere. They were attentive and efficient, ensuring I always had a refill on my beer. The beer selection was great, and Johnathan had great knowledge of all drinks. Overall, a great experience with friendly and skilled service that made the night more enjoyable.

Quality has definitely declined over the last 7 months. They are consistently out of about half the beers on the menu, the wings are considerably less tasty (& less saucy) than they used to be, and the portion amount of the truffle fries side item is almost half the amount as it used to be even just last summer 2024. I don't know what has happened since then, but it's definitely become kind of a bummer to come here. Prices have gone up too; which obviously is understandable, but the quality and amount are declining...Gotta find a new half-off wing/beer place. Sad to say that because we used to love this place.

The atmosphere is great, as the brick and lighting create a great ambiance. Food was good, though not large portions, and they overcharged us for the special.

We went for a date night and service was quick, however they waited to seat us and have us order before notifying us there was a private event in the dining room and we'd have to leave in 30 minutes.

The food here is great! I love Sunday brunch best chicken and waffles I have ever had (imo). Just make sure to arrive before 2pm as the kitchen closes for one hour from 3-4pm. Also in my opinion they do get short staffed when they get busy. There has been a few times it’s taken quit a long time to wait for the food and also the server may not check back after delivery of the food and I have had to flag them down for the check on more than one occasion. I don’t fault them as it’s a small place and gets full really fast at brunch.

profile: Bodega is a Bar/Pub, Restaurant restaurant in columbus with a $$ price range. It has a rating of 4.4/5. It is known for being quick service, romantic, takeout and authentic. Popular dishes include They, Overall and Johnathan.

name: Domo Sushi Kitchen Bar
address: 976 N High St, Columbus, OH 43201, USA

reviews.text: One of the most unique, delicious dinners I’ve had in a while. Stop in for some top notch sushi with a creative flair. Most unique dish - a blend of Italian and Japanese- carbonara udon?!?! Sooo good!!

I had a selfcare day and decided I wanted sushi I’m so glad I picked this place everything was amazing down to the service the guy behind the bar made me feel very comfortable and informed me of things on the menu it was happy hour as well so I got a strawberry smash cocktail, the fried chicken was amazing! Seasoned to perfection and the tiger sushi roll was so delicious I ate it all definitely will be back

Delicious expansive menu of Japanese, Korean, sushi, and fusion dishes. The food was delicious and the service was attentive and friendly.

We will be back soon.

Had the best time this Thursday bringing my family in! They were visiting for the holidays and wanted to grab an early dinner. They have an amazing happy hour for drinks and food which the host told us about. There was a wide range of drinks for everyone’s taste and even n/a ones for those of us participating in dry January! Our server was so helpful with recommendations and answering and questions we had as well as accommodating for allergies. Overall just a great time and experience. Already made a reservation for date night next week!

My husband and I came here for a date night. We saw they opened recently and love exploring new  restaurants in the neighborhood. We were not disappointed!!! Everything was incredibly fresh, perfectly seasoned, and extremely flavorful. The ambiance is cozy yet modern. Welcoming and crisp. Absolutely will be back. We ordered bluefin tuna nigiri, a bento box, crispy rice, plum wine, yellowtail crudo and Berkshire tonkatsu. Everything exceeding our expectations. The owner even came over and checked on us a few times. We were so impressed with the service as well. Our waiter, Austin, was so lovely and patient. He answered our questions and although he said our order would take a while, we got our dinner relatively quick. I highly recommend trying Domo!

profile: Domo Sushi Kitchen Bar is a Restaurant restaurant in columbus with a $$ price range. It has a rating of 4.6/5. It is known for being romantic, comfort food, family friendly, quick service and casual. Popular dishes include Japanese, They and Everything.

name: Drunch Eatery + Bar
address: 995 N 4th St, Columbus, OH 43201, USA

reviews.text: Food was good. Our waiter was nice and attentive. 18% gratuity is added to all bills. The area is small and tables are close together. Not an ideal place for large parties. The manager or owner seemed "put off" because we ordered a drink at the bar while we waited for the rest of our party to arrive, needless to say it didn't help cozy the atmosphere.

First time eating here.  My daughter picked it for my birthday and we could not be more pleased about the location (parking available), atmosphere, service and food.  This is BY FAR the best hollandaise sauce I have ever had in my life.  Our server (Bree) was so sweet and offered suggestions for all of us.  My only critique is the mandatory 18% gratuity.  This was a special occasion but that alone would turn me away for just a place to eat.  I still give it 5 stars! Helluva good hollandaise!!!

From Akron area and found this place a little over a year ago.  Every time we’ve been to Columbus we make it a point to stop out for brunch.

Wait times may be a little long on busy weekends, but once you’re sitting down, servers are 100% attentive, and the kitchen moves fast with GREAT quality food at a very fair price.

Would LOVE if they ever expanded to Akron/Cleveland or Canton area

Visit Details:
•	Date: A few days ago, during the Arnold Sports Festival weekend. Wait times extended, due to the event; understandable as most downtown venues were crowded so this was a re-try.
•	Wait Time: No wait (Thursday morning around 11am.)
•	Parking: Limited; advisable to visit on less busy days for better parking availability

Service:
•	Waitstaff: Friendly, attentive, and accommodating
•	Co-Owner Interaction: Visited our table multiple times, introducing new menu items

Food & Beverages:
•	Wings:
•	Bestie’s Rating: 3/10 – Too spicy to enjoy
•	P’s Rating: 5/10 – Preferred crispier texture and exclusively flat pieces
•	French Toast:
•	Bestie’s Rating: 8/10
•	P’s Rating: 7/10 – Found it basic; desired more sweetness
•	Crab Bennie with Breakfast Potatoes:
•	Bestie’s Rating: 9/10 – Displeased with over-easy egg preparation (which was perfect for P)
•	P’s Rating: 9/10 – Potatoes were too soft
•	Beverages: Coffee and Shirley Temple

Pricing:
•	Total Bill: $67
•	Gratuity: 18% included, plus an additional $10 tip

Despite minor critiques, Drunch Eatery + Bar is a commendable brunch spot. The engaging staff and diverse menu make it worth a visit. For a more relaxed experience, consider visiting during off-peak times.

Stopped to eat before heading back north and was excited we picked this place.  Parking was a bit confusing but not terrible.  The place was busy but moving fast.  Table for 2 maybe waited 6 minutes.  Was greeted by the co owner who took us to our seats;  very friendly as well.  The food choices were too hard as they all sounded great.  Started with the drunch eggroll, which was fantastic. Ended up getting the challah back French toast and 2 different bennies.  My wife had the regular bennie, and I had the avocado. Everything about this place was great,  definitely a must stop.

profile: Drunch Eatery + Bar is a Restaurant restaurant in columbus with a $$ price range. It has a rating of 4.2/5. It is known for being quick service, romantic and casual. Popular dishes include Rating, Bestie, This, Wait, Parking and Beverages.

name: Boom Boom Tacos Tequila & Mezcal
address: 201 Chittenden Ave, Columbus, OH 43201, USA

reviews.text: The staff was A1, every time we finished our chips and dip she would bring some more out as soon as she sees an empty basket also with the drinks very polite but the food however was plain I didn’t really taste any flavor in the American taco I don’t recommend getting that at all but the birria nachos were very good , they don’t give avocado on it usually but I requested it…. They also do Karaoke Night on Tuesdays at 7pm if you’re interested!!

My team is in Ohio to 0lay softball and stopped here for some mexican food. We were sat immediately and received friendly service fast. Food was 100 percent great. Hot and fresh unlike the chain Mexican restaurants. Highly recommend.

This establishment is such a cute spot to grab tacos and a drink after work, especially on taco Tuesday. 😎

I came in around 6:30pm and there weren’t too many people seated, which is what I prefer. I walked into the establishment and was immediately greeted by one of the servers. She brought out a physical menu, but she also clarified that if I scanned the QR code on the table, I would have access to the forming which had all the items in the drinks.

I noticed there was a sign posted about happy hour, which takes place from 4 PM to 7 PM, and then again from 10 PM to midnight. Please navigate to the images to see a picture of the lemon drop cocktail. The cocktail was OK, but I’ve definitely had better. However, for the price I was pretty satisfied.

I decided to try the white queso dip, which was very good with an authentic flavor. The dip was also pretty spicy, so I am assuming there are some type of hot peppers or jalapeños in the recipe.

The Carne Asada taco was OK but I wish the steak had a little more flavor. The fried chicken taco with the side chipotle sauce was okay as well, but again both tacos  needed more flavor. My bill came up to around $25 which I felt was very reasonable.

The overall ambience was pretty chill, and there was nice music playing in the background. I am definitely returning to give this establishment another go around I would highly recommend coming and checking it out for yourself, especially on a Tuesday evening!

Such a cute hole in the wall restaurant! Amazing food incredible staff our waiter sang beautifully as he served food throughout the restaurant. I got the quesabrilla and the happy hour hurricane ( the drink was super sweet they were kind and gave me orange juice so I could handle the rest ) we will definitely be back for more food and great music .
This place had amazing gigantic margaritas and a really wonderful menu with so many options. The corn ribs were phenomenal and I loved my shrimp taco! I hope they add a consume for the birria tacos!

profile: Boom Boom Tacos Tequila & Mezcal is a Restaurant restaurant in columbus with a $$ price range. It has a rating of 4.8/5. It is known for being quick service, authentic and casual. Popular dishes include This and Tuesday.

name: Dave's Hot Chicken
address: 1828 N High St, Columbus, OH 43201, USA

reviews.text: Really solid food. Took forever to move through the line on the day I was there but once I actually placed my order it came very quick. I will say that the spicy level was inconsistent; I ordered the reaper, which requires you to sign a goofy waiver, and the first sandwich I had was spicy but not unbearable.  The second one was very very spicy (which is what I wanted, but it didn't make sense that it was tame the first time).

I got the reaper and it was an absolute hottest thing I ever got. You literally have to sign a waiver to order the reaper... The chicken was good though it has an excellent crunch and extremely moist. I got the very hot and mild as well. The very hot was pretty toasty but enjoyable. Mild was good as well. Definitely worth a try, but don't get the reaper, I'm serious 🥵😭

I visited this place with my boyfriend a week or two ago, and right away, we were welcomed by one of the nicest cashiers I've ever met. His name was Trey, and he was incredibly kind and genuine—it was clear he was happy to be there and to help us. We later found out it was his first day, but you never would’ve guessed it with how well he handled everything!

The food was delicious, the atmosphere was bright and clean, and the manager seemed very supportive of the staff. Even with all of that, the main reason I wanted to leave this review was because of the fantastic service. Trey made such a great impression that we even remembered his name afterward!

We came back the next day (he wasn’t working that time), but we still had a great experience. If you get the chance to be helped by Trey, I’m sure you’ll have just as positive of a visit as we did. Thanks for the great service!
Place was clean and the cashier Ben was super helpful! Tasted great too. Overall great experience. I don’t even like coleslaw but it’s fire here

Dave’s hot chicken offers and amazing fried chicken experience, where the perfectly crispy exterior and juicy, tender meat inside create a balance of flavors that is hard to beat. Each level of heat is thoughtfully crafted, ensuring both spice lovers and those seeking a milder taste can find their ideal heat without compromising on flavor. The menu is simple yet packed with bold, satisfying options.

Equally impressive is the service, especially from Trey, who stands out for his exceptional hospitality. His friendly, attentive demeanor makes customers feel valued and welcomed from the moment they walk in. Trey’s knowledge of the menu and his enthusiasm for the brand shine through, creating a genuinely enjoyable atmosphere. His personalized service adds a special touch that elevates the entire dining experience, making it clear that he takes pride in his work. Dave’s Hot Chicken, with its fantastic food and top-notch service, is a must-visit.

profile: Dave's Hot Chicken is a Restaurant restaurant in columbus with a $$ price range. It has a rating of 4.7/5. It is known for being quick service, authentic and late night. Popular dishes include Trey, Hot Chicken and Dave.

name: Forno Kitchen + Bar
address: 721 N High St, Columbus, OH 43215, USA

reviews.text: We had such a great experience for brunch. Our server was outstanding, very engaging, and personable. The food was fantastic! The breakfast pizza was exactly what I wanted out of a pizza for breakfast. The chicken and waffles are the perfect level of savory and sweet. Lastly, the starter of crispy rice was phenomenal: they are not stingy with thw tuna. And if it's your birthday don't forget to let them know. Not our first time here and definitely not our last.

Casual dining spot to go to if you’re visiting from out of town. Super cozy and chill atmosphere. The service and drinks were top notch. Food is average, and some dishes were lacking flavor, but overall it was still good. Also the portions could be a bit bigger (mainly the salads and proteins). Shout out to Tim for making our night perfect!
Upon visiting Columbus, we stopped into Forno for brunch and I can say that it was a good move. The food was good and the atmosphere was nice. It was very crowded but the service kept up.

I’m from Boston & I’m here visiting my friend in Columbus & this place was the BEST! Highly recommend happy hour as the prices are great & the service is even better. We had Eden as our waitress and she was a QUEEN! The absolute best service ever!!!! 10/10 would recommend to a friend :))

Beware!! They charge extra when you use Credit card!!

Visited Forno today to celebrate my wife’s 50th birthday. We came here after a period of more than a year. Before that we visited Forno many times and had pleasant experiences. However this time the experience was very very bad . We ordered Arancini’s and Roasted Garlic Shrimp. While Roasted Garlic Shrimp was good the Arancini was not. The sauce was very tart.  Having spoiled the taste we decided to move on but the server was nowhere to be seen. We tried to get the attention of reception but the ladies there were busy talking among themselves for more than 15 mins. Finally we as well as other table had to request another server to get our server. When the server got the check we saw they had added a line item called Transaction cost. When I asked them what this was they said it’s a cost for using credit card when I protested the server said they always had it and everyone in Short north charges it . I told her that’s not true . This is first time I saw someone in. Columbus directly pass on the credit charges to customer. It’s said that a restaurant where I used to take my family friend and visitors has reached this level . Will definitely think twice before recommending this place in future.

I have attached photos of two associates who kept talking and did not see our or the other table customers signaling for attention.

I have also attached the bill from the adjoining restaurant to see if they directly charge the credit card fees and you will notice they don’t. I was so enraged I forgot to pick up the Forno bill else I would have posted its pic too

profile: Forno Kitchen + Bar is a Restaurant restaurant in columbus with a $$ price range. It has a rating of 4.5/5. It is known for being romantic, authentic, takeout, family friendly, quick service and casual. Popular dishes include Columbus, Forno, Arancini and When.

name: Alqueria
address: 247 King Ave, Columbus, OH 43201, USA

reviews.text:
Great experience! We went there for the restaurant week and liked everything on the menu. The artichoke was our favorite, hope they gonna put it on permanent menu! We order extra sweet potato fries, they mentioned that it fried twice, but when we ate it's not crispy, but still tastes good. For the main course, pork loin was still too chewy for me.
But overall, I love it. Will go back again. :)

10/10 food - from the ingredients to the flavors, everything about the food was truly outstanding. Perfectly sized portions too! If you are an eater you’ll like having a starter and an entree! The drinks were also interesting and delicious! Friendly staff as well. Definitely want to come back and try more of the menu.

This was a date night with my husband and we enjoyed the service and atmosphere for the occasion.  Food had a great presentation and taste was even better.  We had the homemade hummus and blacked salmon that had great texture and well seasoned for taste.  Blaine had a welcoming personality and not overbearing.   We are looking forward to eating here again soon.  Thank you for having them on offline as they are 10 mins from our jobs and never knew they were here.

This intimate atmosphere in the university district is the great place for a date night or special occasion.  The drinks were good, the build your charcuterie appetizer was really good and so were the duck confit and lamb shank.  Elevated dining for sure, and the price reflects the high quality but 100% worth it.

Visited for the first time on a perfect fall night so everyone was choosing to sit outside. Comfortable patio seating, kind and efficient staff, and massive portions of hearty “home cooked meals.” The fried chicken and braised short ribs were amazing.

profile: Alqueria is a Restaurant restaurant in columbus with a $$ price range. It has a rating of 4.7/5. It is known for being romantic, authentic, late night, comfort food and quick service. A popular dish is This.

name: TaKorea
address: 1556 N High St (Game Arena, Columbus, OH 43201, USA

reviews.text: First time ordering from Takorea. Delicious fusion of korean and mexican food! Hearty portions, and we absolutely loved what we ordered. The Barita nachos and the fried chicken casadilla were delicious! 😋 Highly recommend and will definitely order from them again!

The chef and bartender were absolutely amazing! I took my sister here for her birthday and we had a great time. We ordered 2 KFC tacos with one pineapple taco. We also ordered the spicy Korean wings with the birria nachos. All the food we ordered was incredible! The mixed drinks tasted pretty weak but the mango golden ale was delicious. Our service was very fast and friendly. The restaurant is located inside of a video gaming arena so the atmosphere is definitely geared towards gamers. If it is not your vibe you can always sit right outside. The courtyard is pretty nice. Keep doing a great job team. I can't wait till you open your own stand alone restaurant.

We came to town for a concert and found this place on Google. We decided it sounded interesting, so we walked to the location. We tried 3 different entrees, and we were wowed! My son said it was the best burrito he's ever had. That's saying something because he's super picky! The woman who waited on us so extremely friendly, fast, and personable. Made us feel at ease since we weren't locals. When we're back on Columbus, we will definitely be coming back!

We had such a fun time here! A bit hard to find but we asked someone and they told us we had to walk into the Gaming place to find it! Super fun atmosphere drinks and food were great! Margaritta was our server/bartender and she was amazinggg. Her personality made us feel right at home and her drinks were top tier!

A really fun place, that happens to have really great fusion food.  The chicken is always delicious and I always order it, but the tacos really were just as excellent.  Hidden away next to Gateway film center, it is worth checking out. Highly recommended.

profile: TaKorea is a Restaurant restaurant in columbus with a $$ price range. It has a rating of 4.5/5. It is known for being quick service, comfort food and authentic. A popular dish is Highly.

name: Roots Natural Kitchen
address: 10 E 15th Ave, Columbus, OH 43201, USA

reviews.text: The place is clean and decorated lovely. The service is always great giving me some samples, but I feel like that I am eating a bowl of plain and healthy workout food. Also, it is weird to mix rice with a lot of salad leaves. Anyway, their dishes taste pretty fresh and healthy, especially sweet potatoes. It must be a good place for ppl who work out.

This place is my jam. When I'm being good to myself. All this stuff is high octane for the brain and body. Not just the greatly curated menu, no, I also mean the atmosphere and staff. As shop on a square, Roots Natural Kitchen, is a fairly new option thanks to a North High St. upgrade that affectionately applauds generations of Buskeyes and beautifully helps the current students thrive on an invigorating campus. I ordered and devoured a custom BBQ Tofu bowl. It was banging! The service was amazing and that always makes my day. I mean, you didn't have to be nice to me and serve me delicious food. You certain could have mailed it in and served me a healthy meal and that's that. But no, you hooked it up. That I truly appreciate! THANK YOU ROOTS NATURAL KITCHEN!!!!

This is a great restaurant! The food is very healthy and delicious. The building is difficult accessibility wise and may require extra help for individuals using mobility aides. The indoors is very clean, and sensory friendly with dimmed lighting!
Service was subpar, actually quite rude. But regardless food was slap. Felt good eating healthy and still had enough for leftovers

A good, healthy, quick option. Only 4 stars because it’s nothing out of this world, but I’m so glad I went and the flavors were good. I’ll definitely be back when I’m running low on time and want a quick, healthy bite to eat. Their bowl sizes are good, you get what you pay for. The staff is friendly and helpful. The space is nothing special, just table and chairs for a quick sit down. I was excited by the idea of Roots, thinking the inside would be all cutesy, but it was more of a fast-food/Chipotle style feel.

profile: Roots Natural Kitchen is a Restaurant restaurant in columbus with a $ price range. It has a rating of 4.3/5. It is known for being quick service and healthy. A popular dish is This.

name: Yoshi (OSU Campus)
address: 1502 N High St, Columbus, OH 43201, USA

reviews.text: Great atmosphere. Had Hawaain Roll and Spicy Tuna rolls. They were both excellent not to mention they were reasonably priced. Their crab Rangoon was delicious l! Highly recommended!

Food was very tasty. Crab Rangoons had the best filling I’ve had on campus. I’ll definitely be back for more. The Pad Thai is lovely. Not dry, a great mix of veggies that you never get normally at a campus restaurant. Really nice service and was very fast.
The place is small but that's what's good about it, the music the atmosphere the decor all amazing definitely would come again
The food is so yummy and the woman at the register is always so friendly and provides prompt service!
Super great experience! We got dumplings and a hibachi bowl that was delicious, and I'm sure I'll be back for boba. Good atmosphere, indie music and overall chill vibe. Will come again!

profile: Yoshi (OSU Campus) is a Restaurant restaurant in columbus with a $$ price range. It has a rating of 4.5/5. It is known for being quick service, comfort food, casual and authentic.

name: Press Grill
address: 741 N High St, Columbus, OH 43215, USA

reviews.text: If you don’t order the pizza and smash burger, double with cheese and bacon, you are not getting the experience you deserve here. They also serve Garage beer, which is a local brew. The small pub feel is cozy and warm and the service was impeccable. We actually went twice in our three day stay just b/c it was so good.  Oh yeah, I almost forgot. The service suggested a potato appetizer that was stupid good.  We didn’t take a photo. It was just quickly eaten.

1st time in Columbus and googled places near the convention center… GREAT food, GREAT prices, Great staff, Great atmosphere, what more do you need to know! We had the onion rings ( perfect light breading), calamari, white pizza, burger,brisket sandwich, Mac n cheese , pesto chicken ,burger melt and some drinks! We all loved it!

Honestly, great establishment overall. Food is great, I got the meat loaf sandwich, and it was Fantastic. Servers are quick and dependable. Definitely a little loud for my liking, but that is to be expected at this style of establishment. Definitely recommended this place if coming through town.

I brought an unannounced party of 13 here (on a Monday) after our pre-arranged dinner plans fell through. They gave us delicious food and great service. My only regret is that my party was mostly teenagers, and I wasn't sure if the server was properly tipped!

These people do great work and deliver great food. I can't comment on the drinks since I was chaperoning teenagers, but the menu looked like the bar had tasty stuff! Give them a try; from cheeseburger to fried octopus, it's all delicious!
A very cozy spot. Good food for the price. Their meatloaf was amazing.

profile: Press Grill is a Restaurant restaurant in columbus with a $ price range. It has a rating of 4.5/5. It is known for being quick service, romantic and casual. Popular dishes include They and Definitely.

name: Fireproof Restaurant
address: 1026 N High St, Columbus, OH 43201, USA

reviews.text: My friend had her birthday dinner here and we had a blast! Our server, Dan, was awesome and super personable. We ordered the Cajun chicken pasta, crab cake, lobster tacos, empanadas, salmon bites, and fried rice. The drinks were great as well. Everything was amazing! At the end of dinner, Dan brought out a surprise slice of cake for my friend, which was also delicious. I loved the vibe and will definitely be back!

Great food! We loved this place and would definitely go back for the food. We went during happy hour when 15 of the appetizers were half off. There were some weird vibes from someone working the bar who told us that all of the appetizers were half off, which isn’t true since we’d seen the lineup on the website before coming in, then when the bill came he charged full price for one of the ones we’d ordered that was half off…we just felt like he was trying to pull a fast one, but good experience other than that!

We ordered the wagyu sliders (so good!), butter beef Vietnamese summer rolls (the beef was so good and the flavor was amazing), and bang bang shrimp (good with a little spicy kick, but wish they were a tiny bit less fried).

Dan, our server was absolutely wonderful!! He was informative, quick, engaging, and just so fun. The food was incredible, Dan's recommendations were spot on, the pork belly was the best!!! We also had bang bang shrimp, wagyu empanadas, and dumplings, also the cheesecake for dessert... Everything was so good!

Dan was an absolutely amazing server. He was able to give us great insight on the menu and made amazing suggestions. We ordered everything he suggested and we were not disappointed. Our experience was great and we cannot wait to go back.

I loved this restaurant. The drinks were amazing and definitely had a kick. The food was creative and so tasty, especially the wagyu sliders. Service was friendly and consistent. Happy hour had lots of incredible options. I highly recommend!

profile: Fireproof Restaurant is a Bar/Pub, Restaurant, Night Club restaurant in columbus with a $$ price range. It has a rating of 4.3/5. It is known for being quick service, authentic and takeout. A popular dish is Everything.

name: MODA Restaurant and Bar - Columbus
address: 3100 Olentangy River Rd, Columbus, OH 43202, USA

reviews.text: I came here for dinner on a Sunday evening and it felt pretty laid-back and informal. It has a classy ambiance, but it's in the hotel lobby and not really separated from guests coming and going. We sat ourselves and most people there were just grabbing drinks from the bar. There was a wide variety of attire, so you definitely don't need to come dressed formally. I wouldn't call it a nice date night vibe, but mostly focused on elevated cuisine. The menu is okay, not super extensive or exciting, but the food was excellent. For starters, the pretzel bites had a unique texture to them -- reminded me a tiny bit of a yeast donut but a little thicker. The salmon entree was phenomenal -- delicious glaze, great crust on the salmon, silky smooth and rich puree, everything on the plate meshed well together.. 9/10 dish. I tasted a bite of the mushroom risotto and it was quite good, too. Service was good. I'd come back for another great meal.

We came in after the Chelsea game and it was extremely busy with everyone arriving at once! Things were moving slow as would be expected, but it seemed like the entire staff from bartenders, to servers, to management were hustling to the best of their ability. When food and cocktails  reached us it was well prepared and a manager named Patrick stopped by to talk to us for a few minutes to explain and apologize. He seemed sincere and kind even though I saw a few guests being rude to him when he tried to explain the same things to them. As someone who has worked in service I really think a host would have been helpful as we all just sat at once and flooded our orders into the bar and kitchen?

Moda is located inside the Residence Inn hotel, as you walk in to the left, and they extend for the majority of the lobby. We went for happy hour ( sun-tue, 5-7 pm) for the great prices on both drinks and appetizers. We started off with pretzel bites. They came with a type of mustard and cheese sauce. They weren’t fresh, but still really good. Even though they don’t have it listed, they do have a veggie patty to substitute to all the burgers if you just ask. I ordered a Moda Burger, both it and the fries it came with were delicious! After happy hour ended we ordered one more drink and I went with an holiday spritz. It was perfect! Our server was great and extremely attentive.

We came here to celebrate our date night together and truly loved the corn ribs and drinks . Great service it took a little long to greet us but they were short staffed that day

Our waiter was on top of making sure we had what we needed and we will be back to try out more menu options
The pesto bread was a bit over powering but loved the color it gave to the dish

Place is in a hotel and very wide open, so hard to give it a good atmosphere score.

Overall 5, food 5, service 5.

Got the salmon. It was flat-put excellent. Nothing more to say. Will absolutely be back.

Server was a junior at OSU and talked through her experience in going to SDSU then coming back to OSU. I believe her name was Taylor. This was the conversation my daughter needed to hear to make up her mind. She has since accepted the OSU offer and is totally stoked to go in the fall. Pass on my regards to Taylor as she was super friendly & helpful.

Will go back!

profile: MODA Restaurant and Bar - Columbus is a Restaurant restaurant in columbus with a $$ price range. It has a rating of 4.5/5. It is known for being romantic, authentic, takeout, late night, fancy and casual. Popular dishes include They, Moda Burger, Will and Taylor.

name: Ethyl & Tank
address: 19 E 13th Ave, Columbus, OH 43201, USA

reviews.text: Food was high quality and delicious! Atmosphere was definitely more college bar than restaurant. Service was very friendly and attentive, but could have been improved with some simple accommodations. E.g., my wife wasn't able to get a cup of coffee, because they didn't want to make a fresh pot in the afternoon, and I was denied the addition of a fried egg on my burger because "the breakfast stuff had already been put away." I found this odd, that a simple egg could not be found in the kitchen. In the end, I must say, I really didn't need the egg, as the burger was fabulous as provided! I would definitely go back for the food, and shoot for a bit earlier next time to try the brunch menu.

My husband I are touring the Big 10 stadiums and stopped in Columbus for the Hoosier Buckeyes game. We visited Ethyl and Tank for brunch before the game and it was awesome! It was right across the street from our air bnb and a quick walk to the stadium. The drink specials (at 8am) and the food were great. The Brie and waffle fries was a treat and my husbands breakfast burrito looked good. After the game we went back for drinks and loved the rowdy atmosphere and the DJ. Thanks for the great service and hospitality despite our IU attire.
A great and spontaneous dinner at Ethyl & Tank this evening. Excellent grub, exceptionally nice staff, fun atmosphere, and BIG ASS draught beers for $5 during Happy Hour! 🍺...W⭕️⭕️T‼️
Stopped in for a quick drink and enjoyed the visit. Fun vibe, decent beer selection, friendly bartenders.

The fruity Pebble pancakes are super delicious!
The presentation was amazing!!!
Great bar. Good seating. Good people. I definitely be back!!

profile: Ethyl & Tank is a Bar/Pub, Restaurant restaurant in columbus with a $ price range. It has a rating of 4.2/5. It is known for being quick service and authentic. Popular dishes include Ethyl and Tank.

name: OX-B's
address: 1177 N High St, Columbus, OH 43201, USA

reviews.text: BEST TOFU WRAP IN THE CITY! I’m here constantly for lunch and my coworkers are constantly jealous and always ask if I’m doing an OX-Bs run. The food is ALWAYS fresh and the service is always on par. Can’t thank the staff enough for making everything experience better than the last!

I got off doordash, came over to google searched for my location just to leave it a 5 star review. The food never disappoints, they never forget my drink. Buffalo chicken wrap, smothered corn bread, waffle fries fantastic. Very affordable, quality food, fast service. A blessing in the Columbus area.

Went for the first time and oh my goodness.. the   original slop sandwich is where it's at. Wish they had meal options but the food was still very good. The drink area needs a really good cleaning and wish I knew it was more like serve yourself kind of deal.. there's no ketchup and not to sure if you're suppose to ask for it , but the food was awesome.. wish more cheese came on the cheese waffle fries.

The food is great, but tonight is the last time I'll order food from this location.

I ordered a 24 piece boneless wings, which comes with sauces. I ordered onion rings, which also comes with sauce. I ordered fries and Mac and cheese. NO sauce was delivered with our order. I even added like 4 sauces to the order and I got no sauce. I'm done with this location because it's not the first or even the second time this has happened.

So you should definitely go here. But do yourself a favor and pick your food up and make sure the sauce is in there.

Yum yum yum!! The chicken and waffles fries with white Mac is a whole filling meal. The tofu wings were fantastic. I loved that the jalapeño poppers had red peppers in them. It was a refreshing touch to them! The salad mix used for the grilled chicken was super fresh and crisp which I absolutely loved!

profile: OX-B's is a Restaurant restaurant in columbus with a $ price range. It has a rating of 4.6/5. It is known for being authentic, takeout, comfort food, quick service and affordable.

name: Pelino's Pasta
address: 245 King Ave, Columbus, OH 43201, USA

reviews.text: Disappointing experience that fell far short of its price tag. Opted for the tasting menu. At over $115 per person, the portions were laughably small, with the only generously sized dish being the ganache cheesecake—an odd contrast to the rest of the meal. While some dishes, like the risotto, truffle bruschetta, and pesto gnocchi, were flavorful, the overall tasting menu failed to deliver the balance of quality and portion expected from a fine dining experience. The classic parmesan pasta tossed in a parmesan wheel was visually impressive but overwhelmingly salty and pungent. The salad, which seemed more like a palette cleanser, was nothing more than a few arugula leaves, some citrus chunks and tiny anchovy slivers, making it an noticeably underwhelming course. The mocktails, despite their premium price, were unimpressive—one tasted like a basic lemon soda, and the other was a bland carbonated orange drink. Service, while friendly, was slow, with long gaps between courses that disrupted the dining flow. The establishment was cozy but a little loud between patron chatter. To make matters worse, our group, which does not eat pork, was served tortellini with prosciutto, requiring a return (we informed before the meal started of no pork items). The lack of protein across the board made the meal feel incomplete, and ultimately, we left unsatisfied and feeling overcharged. Despite the kind staff, the overall experience was underwhelming, and we won’t be returning.

Came to celebrate Valentine's Day and it was our first time at the restaurant. We opted for the full tasting menu and we were not disappointed. Every dish was savory and delicious. Alicia, our server, was unassuming and intentional in her care of our space. Each dish arrived with a story of historical and cultural significance, we were utterly transported. Such an unpretentious vibe for all the impeccabilities being served! The owner Christina (sp?) came by to greet us and shared with us her family's love and roots in the culture and cuisine. It was an overall 10/10 experience.

Sean with Offline - BEST TIRAMISU !! Now this was an upscale restaurant in the heart of Italian village.  The food was made fresh and it was very elegant and upscale.  Portions were a little small but they used quality ingredients.  We heard the menu changes monthly, and the set up is you go with a 3, 4, or 7 course dinner selecting from different options.  (7courses is set I believe).  they also have wine pairings for each course but we didn’t participate because of dry January :/

From the January menu (theme was Best of 2024) the squash and hazelnut pasta was my favorite. The cacio e Pepe tossed in the cheese wheel table-side is also very good and a classic menu item. Highly recommend the wine pairing too! Portion sizes are not large but not so small that a 3 course meal isn’t enough, though if you’re hungrier I’d recommend the 4 course option. The waiters do a full menu run-through before you order so you know how everything is prepared (I.e. what all of the Italian words are) which is great so you don’t have to ask or secretly google anything. The staff are all super nice and the hostess that night (who might be the owner?) is from Italy and knows a lot about the wine list which is an impressive selection of Italian glasses from all throughout Italy (I was particularly surprised about how many options there were from less common Italian regions, white wines in particular). I will definitely be returning to try more menu items and wines!

Decided to try Pelino's for a night out with our oldest son on New Years' Day.   The restaurant is in an older building with exposed brick and a nice, small-ish dining room with tasteful art on the walls.  The kitchen is open, which is always a plus.  We were greeted on arrival (nice lady from Bologna), and seated promptly for our reservation.

Our waiter was very good - knew the menu well, had his pronunciation down, and was not intrusive in handling the table.

Service and aesthetics aside, the dining room was a bit chilly.  Even walking through towards the kitchen, there wasn't a lot of temperature change.

You are guided to a three-course meal and strongly encouraged to not go a la carte.  Some of the "add ons" were pushed a bit.  Know that a bottle of water will be $7.50,  and the focaccia (three small strips of focaccia with a tomato  paste on top and [unsure why] some olive oil to dip) is $8.50.

The meal was significantly overpriced for what it was.  My wife's Tortellini in Brodo had four tortellini and about an ounce of broth on them.  My Risotto dell'Inverno had maybe five spoonfuls of risotto and was out in under ten minutes.  The Carbonara served was equally about ten bites of a tubetti-type pasta with a few not-very-crisp pieces of guanciale on top.

Dessert-wise, my panna cotta was OK, I ended up eating only the panna cotta itself and not the bizarre mixture of spiced smear of something, differently spiced crumbles, and oddly spiced whipped cream dots on the plate.  The tiramisu that came to the table was unique in that it was served in a moka pot, but was otherwise marginal.   My wife's Il Gioiello dell'Inverno was marginal at best.  Finally, expect a $4 espresso if you want to cap the dinner off.

A three course "meal" (a tiny antipasti, pasta, and a desert) , glass of wine, two bottles of water, a blood orange soda, and facaccia coming to just over $225 should not have you walking away hungry.  I guess I am grateful that they bill themselves as an "osteria" instead of a "ristorante" as the bill would have been significantly higher.

Save your self a significant amount of money, this is just not worth it.

profile: Pelino's Pasta is a Restaurant restaurant in columbus with a Unknown price range. It has a rating of 4.4/5. It is known for being romantic, expensive, late night, comfort food, family friendly, quick service, fancy and casual. Popular dishes include Italian, Service, January, Italy and Inverno.

name: bb.q Chicken Columbus
address: 17 E Lane Ave, Columbus, OH 43201, USA

reviews.text: Your classic Korean fried chicken with so many options to choose from! Great flavor, crispy and good value for what you pay. For some reason they had the place so hot inside during winter. The service was great and the place was not very busy for a weekend time. Was nice to see they had a bar area and served alcohol since it wasn’t super clear online. Always get a Sapporo draft and it was refreshing as usual. We tried the honey garlic and Gangnam style wings and both tasted great. I wish I could give them 4.5*, just wish it wasn’t as hot and they had happy hour or drink specials to checkout! I really hope they make it here as this is a difficult location. Will have to try tiger sugar Nextdoor for drinks next time.

Good food, great location! The wings were fried golden and crispy, sweet potato fries were outstanding. I wish that the wings themselves are also slightly flavored and not completely relying on the sauce to provide the flavor.

Chicken pieces are big and they give you like 8 boneless the taste is amazing , I gave them 4 star because when I went back to eat my leftovers had a foul smell and I threw up . But honestly I'm so fat I'll go again it was too good!

The Food was amazing and Christine , our server was so kind and helpful. Our Food came out hot and fresh and Christine never left us unattended. The only place where spending alot of money on wings is justified!

1st time dining in, it was secluded and comfy with really good hot fresh chicken. Right across from CVS so i run my errands then sit n relax. Even the service is friendly and warm. About $15 but the chicken by itself is worth it, It came with white pickle radish which was yummy yummy and  free drink refills. Left satisfied with food leftover for dinner later.

profile: bb.q Chicken Columbus is a Restaurant restaurant in columbus with a $$ price range. It has a rating of 4.5/5. It is known for being late night, comfort food, affordable and authentic. A popular dish is Christine.

name: Santos Restaurant & Bar
address: 1079 N High St, Columbus, OH 43201, USA

reviews.text: I visited with a friend for dinner on a Saturday night. I would rate the  service as a 5/5 as the waitress and management were very attentive. I would give the food a 3.5/ 5 as the amount of food my friend got with their meal was not great for the price, and while my food tasted okay and my portion was plentiful, it didn’t taste amazing. My drink was a 3.5/5 as the presentation was nice but it seemed to be low on alcohol. My cake was a 4/5 as it was moist and flavorful. The ambiance was a 5/5 as the restaurant was beautifully decorated and great for photos. Overall, if you are interested in visiting this restaurant, I’d say give it a try.

First time here for a date night and decor of this place is amazing! The service was great. It was a slow night which worked in our favor.  Our waiter was very knowledgeable and consistently available. We started off with the devils eggs they were good not amazing but good. I had the chophouse punch and I didn’t care for it. I also had the firecracker sushi which was definitely delicious!! Very impressive and it was beautifully plated. My wife had the filet steak and she a bit disappointed that it had little to no flavor but was cooked to her liking. The mashed potatoes with added lobster was enjoyable. The brussels sprouts surprisingly were extremely flavorful and like nothing I’ve tasted before and I’ve tried some and definitely wasn’t a fan but they’ve made me one of theirs for sure!  We were consistently checked on throughout our meal and the clean up as we finished one dish was impressive. This is definitely a place you want to look nice and take many pictures. The overall experience here was definitely delightful. We will be back!

The atmosphere was young, colorful, and vibrant  . My husband loved his faroe island salmon. The potatoes in his dish was delicious. His dish tasted better than mine. I ordered the blackened fish snapper, I didn't like it.The drinks were good. The atmosphere created a nice date night.

So I know this review might be confusing, because my wife and I had a fairly good time. Let's start with the atmosphere looking more like a club, than an actual restaurant.  Accompanied with pop music that you would find at a club. We were seated at a high table (even tho I reserved outside seating). I should've pushed for what I requested, as you will read about later. When we walked into the restaurant, the 1st thing that I noticed was some groups brought there kids. Now mind you, the average cost for an entree is around 40 dollars per plate. Once seated, my wife and I noticed one group, who allowed their toddler to jump and run around one of the booths. This booth happened to be right next to our table. With pricing between 30 to 60 dollars per plate, I was quite confused on why the staff allowed those to take place. At any rate, our waiter was very knowledgeable and helpful on drinks and food. Although we enjoyed our meal, while celebrating our wedding anniversary, we couldn't get over the toddler constantly running and jumping on the booth next to us. And the craziest part was when that group finally decided to leave, they were replaced with another group coming in, celebrating their 1 year olds birthday. The combined anesthetics of this restaurant is not children friendly, nor should it be.

Santos should require an age restriction and parents should keepbtjere children in check. I didn't spend 250.00 on a meal to be interrupted by a lack of babysitting. Other than that, the food was excellent.

First visit, late afternoon brunch.

Pros:
-Had the place mostly to ourselves
-Excellent service, our waiter was attentive but never overbearing
-Food came out quick and was the perfect temperature
-Beautiful restaurant, nice ambiance
-Effort to make the day special, strawberry jello-shots

Cons:
-Half of our party of 6 was not impressed with the food. Nothing exactly wrong but not anything they’d order again.

While some of us were disappointed in the food, all of us had a great experience and would try other items next time. At the end of the meal our server brought over complimentary strawberry Jell-O shots because we were celebrating a birthday. It was a fun surprise and we appreciated the extra effort. The staff made us feel so welcome.

profile: Santos Restaurant & Bar is a Restaurant restaurant in columbus with a Unknown price range. It has a rating of 3.9/5. It is known for being quick service, romantic, late night and family friendly. Popular dishes include First and This.

name: Fourth Street Taproom & Kitchen
address: 1810 N 4th St, Columbus, OH 43201, USA

reviews.text:
Fourth Street Taproom & Kitchen is a beloved spot that holds a special place in my heart, especially from my days living on E 18th Ave with my roommates. This cozy, welcoming bar quickly became our go-to hangout, thanks to its fantastic food, great drinks, and unbeatable atmosphere. The Bosco sticks are a must-try—cheesy, warm, and perfectly paired with marinara sauce—while the BBQ wings are smoky, tender, and absolutely delicious. Every bite feels like comfort food done right.

What really sets Fourth Street Taproom apart is its amazing outdoor space. The back patio is spacious and inviting, complete with cornhole boards that make for endless fun when the weather is nice. It’s the perfect place to relax with friends, enjoy a cold drink, and soak up the lively vibe.

Over time, it’s become a tradition for us to kick off March Madness here. The energy during the games is electric, with plenty of screens, great drink specials, and a crowd that’s just as passionate about sports as we are. Whether you’re there for the food, the games, or just a good time, Fourth Street Taproom & Kitchen never disappoints. It’s a true neighborhood gem!

Street parking, table and bar seating as well as some bench style seating. Table service. Everyone friendly.

Could use some cleaning. Took a while to get acknowledged but service good from then on. Got onion petals (Forgot to take a photo before I ate some) and a veggie burger with fries, sode of the carolina reaper sauce.

Everything was alright in flavor. I like the carolina reaper sauce, it's spicy but its a vingar based sauce. So if you like crystal but wish it was more spicy, this is what you should get.

Nothing great nothing bad, an alright place with friendly service and a fairly good selection on tap.
I am obsessed with this place! They have amazing food and great deals every day. The drinks are delicious and the music is on point. You have to try it!
Fun local bar. Great servers. Good prices and vibe!

I don’t give 5 stars often- thankfully we left the crazy area of short north on a Saturday and found this. Turkey melt was delicious! And decent prices too. Beer a lil pricey at $6. But not bad. Fries were bangin too! Def some college kids getting a little rowdy but overall my kinda vibe. Everyone was super nice from the dude bartender with the stache to the waitress outside and the young doorman. Everyone was super friendly. One student at the bar gave up his seat next to him for me as my gf and I sat down. lol we’re 35 years old soo not old timers but we sure felt like it walking down short north.

profile: Fourth Street Taproom & Kitchen is a Bar/Pub, Restaurant restaurant in columbus with a $ price range. It has a rating of 4.2/5. It is known for being romantic, authentic, expensive, comfort food, family friendly, quick service, affordable and casual. Popular dishes include Fourth Street Taproom, Everyone and Kitchen.

name: Diaspora
address: 2118 N High St, Columbus, OH 43201, USA

reviews.text: I love this place! I have eaten here many times, and I finally wanted to leave a positive review. My go-to meal is the Soon Tofu Stew, and I request that the meat is left out of it. They are always kind enough to do so, and the stew always tastes delicious. It reminds me of the stew I ate while studying abroad in Korea, so I hope more people come here and enjoy the food!
Food 3.5. Good price  for large portions with the boxes.  Sashimi was a bit large  and harder to eat. Street parking  available.

Went here twice. First time got the salmon killer roll. Was a bit expensive for what I got, but still pretty good. Second time I got the ramen (photo included). Genuinely looked and tasted like it came straight from a package of instant noodles. I asked the waitress about it, and she confirmed they were instant noodles. Asked to replace it with the udon. They tried to charge me for both. Will not be coming back.

It is the only authentic Korean restaurant around campus. Side dishes are always amazing. Beef Bibimbap tastes authentic with Korean spicy sauce and various vegetables. Ramen tastes great with a half boiled egg and authentic spicy broth, but it tastes like the instant ramen noodles from Asian groceries. Sushi rice is hot, which could be cooled. I like their rices more than noodles. Anyway, the lunch special coming with a Ramen and a set of Sushi cost less than $15.

I love this place- real good food, prompt service and fair prices. They have lunch specials that are tasty and for a good price.

Returned spring 2024- amazing udon and great lunch specials!

profile: Diaspora is a Bar/Pub, Restaurant restaurant in columbus with a $$ price range. It has a rating of 4.6/5. It is known for being expensive, authentic, affordable and quick service. Popular dishes include They, Korean, Ramen and Sushi.

name: The Rossi Kitchen & Bar
address: 895 N High St, Columbus, OH 43215, USA

reviews.text:
The Rossi is one of our favorite spots in the Short North!
Their chicken parm is absolutely phenomenal - the saude is rich and flavorful, and the chicken is perfectly cooked, never dry.
The mussels are always delicious.
The bread service is a must! The butter with black salt takes it to another level!
We also tried the mushroom pesto pizza, and it was incredible.
The drinks can be excellent, depending on the bartender. Or good otherwise.

A special shoutout to Amanda, the general manager - she’s fantastic! Always smiling, checking in on tables, and making sure everything is running smoothly.

Rossi is a must-visit in the Short North!

I came in to celebrate my birthday, and Lindsey and Grace made it an unforgettable experience! Lindsey crafted amazing drinks, while Grace ensured everything was perfect. They recommended the Truffle Pizza and the French 75—both were fantastic. I’ll definitely be back for happy hour!

This is definitely a contender for Columbus’ best pasta. Have been waiting to review until I had experienced both the table service & dining in at the bar! Great selection of liquor, quick and attentive service, and best of all, HALF OFF WINE on Wednesdays! Pasta, wine, ambient environment. Will be back!

We were given free gift cards from a friend and popped in to check out this restaurant. It was so classy and swanky and the staff were so friendly and helpful. We started off with a couple of drinks that were delicious and moved on to a couple of appetizers. The appetizers were so unique and both were really good. We ordered a pizza for your main entree and a couple more drinks and again all of it was amazing. We have already told all of our friends how good it was and are planning another trip!

We went there for my sons birthday celebration, the food was really good. We had Rossi burger, Truffle pizza( moms favorite with no red sauce), crust was awesome. We had fried ravioli , bruchetta and calamari which were all good. Bruchetta bread was a bit soggy in the middle. I would wanna go back to try other shareables that sounded all good. That would be a nice if they had a small candle with the desert that we ordered since they already knew we were there for a birthday:(

profile: The Rossi Kitchen & Bar is a Bar/Pub, Restaurant restaurant in columbus with a $$ price range. It has a rating of 4.4/5. It is known for being quick service, romantic, fancy and authentic. Popular dishes include Truffle Pizza, Short North, Rossi, Lindsey and Grace.

name: Standard Hall
address: 1100 N High St, Columbus, OH 43201, USA

reviews.text: Genuinely one of the best sports bars I’ve ever been to - incredible deals on drinks and food ($4 for a TON of wings!) for game days. Easy to grab a table and stay a while. Double thumbs up for playing sound during games!
Great food, great prices, friendly service.  The happy hour prices are stellar! $2 well drinks?? Nuts. The music and atmosphere are incredible. Immaculate vibes!

My family and I stopped in for an early dinner while in town. We caught the end of happy hour and fed our family of 6 very reasonably priced! The food was amazing! The staff was super friendly. We sat outside and the kids were entertained with the games on the patio. We were able to bring our pup and they brought her her own water dish and gave her some love ❤️ I would highly recommend!
On Sunday brunch Brooke served me, she made my St Paddy’s day one to remember. Amazing service and the sweetest girl ever, so friendly and food was great.

Came here last weekend and had such a great time. Jane was our bartender/server and was very attentive, had a great attitude, and looked happy to be there. The drinks came out so quick and the food was great. Will be returning!

profile: Standard Hall is a Restaurant restaurant in columbus with a $$ price range. It has a rating of 4.2/5. It is known for being quick service, authentic, late night and family friendly.

name: Tacos Rudos
address: 1086 N 4th St, Columbus, OH 43201, USA

reviews.text: My first bite, I knew I had to make a review about this place. The food is so delicious with so much flavor! I’m usually iffy about eating fish, but after hearing that their Red Snapper taco is “the best fish taco in Ohio” I had to try it and boy, am I glad I did. I cannot stop talking about how delicious the red snapper taco is. I love the fact that they bread the fish which gives it a crunchy texture and makes the taco 1000x more delicious. I originally got 1 asada taco and 1 red snapper but after eating, I had to order another snapper. The asada taco is good as well, especially the salsa on top of it. When I go back to Budds, I won’t be able to try anything else. The food is a little pricey, it was $36 just for my food and two drinks, but if the food is that delicious it might just be worth it.

Fast food Mexican restaurant inside Budd Diary Food Hall. They have the traditional torta and tacos. They have 3 vegan options if you skip the cheese and mayo. The torta , nachos and quesadilla. They come with shiitake mushrooms and potato’s and pico and guac. I ordered the torta and some fresh made guac. It was pretty tasty

Everything here is freshly made and delicious, I highly recommend the fish tacos and guacamole. The staff are very welcoming and hospitable. The location can be difficult to find, but Tacos Rudos is located at the back of the food hall and they have a spacious and inviting patio right outside the doors. This is our favorite place for tacos in Columbus!

I was told by a close friend that this place has the best authentic tacos 🌮 in town .
I was at bud dairy so I felt like trying it . I chooses beef and chicken tacos and the concept was so good and the flavor was great.
The ingredients are so fresh and combination taste is so good .
U will enjoy it for sure if u tried it .

The BEST tacos in Columbus- I won’t get fish tacos anywhere else because I’m disappointed. Only Taco Rudos for me.  Outstanding service, welcoming and genuinely warm. Food is always fresh.  Can’t say enough about this place.

profile: Tacos Rudos is a Restaurant restaurant in columbus with a $ price range. It has a rating of 4.7/5. It is known for being expensive, healthy, quick service and authentic. Popular dishes include They, Snapper Taco, The Fish, Asada Taco and Columbus.

name: Brassica in the Short North
address: 680 N High St, Columbus, OH 43215, USA

reviews.text: Absolutely amazing! If you are looking for high quality Mediterranean cuisine, fast service, and a casual yet vibrant atmosphere- this is your place. Plus they have amazing vegetarian and vegan options!

I love brassica so much. Go to place anytime. Best Mediterranean foods. Their Falafels are very crispy and made fresh. Hummus Bowl is a must. Fried onions and pita chips as toppings are perks!! I can die for their pickled cucumbers and roasted veggies. Brassica fries are too good, well seasoned. Ambiance is also very calm and aesthetic. Zhug hot sauce and special sauce are my personal choices.
The food was sooo good! Honestly, I didn’t expect it to be that amazing. It was quick, delicious, and way better than many restaurants with long lines and slow service. Definitely a hidden gem
I had the salad bowl with rice and lentils. Very nice idea: gourmet ingredients and nice seating area. The restaurant is close to the convention center.

A very unique take on Mediterranean. The menu was a little confusing at first, but the employees were helpful. Everything tasted great and was extremely fresh. The pita was fluffy and hot, fresh from the oven. The hummus was fantastic! I really enjoyed this meal and thought it was perfect for a hot day. Overall very fresh and a solid meal! I was a little sad they don’t offer gyros meat, but the chicken was still great.

profile: Brassica in the Short North is a Restaurant restaurant in columbus with a $$ price range. It has a rating of 4.8/5. It is known for being romantic, healthy, authentic, quick service and casual. A popular dish is Mediterranean.

name: Genghis Grill
address: 1865 N Pearl St, Columbus, OH 43201, USA

reviews.text:
Their supreme fried rice bowl was fire! Full of flavor and it’s enough to feed two people depending on how much you eat. I will definitely be adding this spot to my weekly lunch rotation.
Keep up the good work!

Fourth time here. It's nice, especially when Paul, the man who makes my meal, remembered me so quickly after just 2 times. Good food and not hard on my budget. Love that low-sodium soy sauce is available. Nothing fancy; just good grub at reasonable prices. Update 2/4/2025: Food is great, quick and convenient. Employees are polite. Healthy options. BOGO deals often. All good.

Very friendly staff and delicious options whether you create your own or pick one of their bowls.

Pictured: egg roll bowl, spicy orange chicken and noodles, boom boom chicken bowl.
This Genghis Grill is a bit different but nonetheless amazing 🤩 The menu was great and easy to use. Employees are very nice and knowledgeable which absolutely helps make a good day even better!!!
